intro: Turnera ibateguara, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
